body: Please, I am 1h in and still haven't found a full non-templated example of how to generate the client.! :)

issue.title: Request for Clarification in Generate an API client Documentation
issue.body:
## Problem statement

In this documentation: https://goswagger.io/generate/client.html
there is a link to the todo-list client (https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/tree/master/examples/todo-list/client)

and following that link there is a code example of how to use/setup a default client.
This example code has this line:
`  resp, err := apiclient.Default.Operations.All(operations.AllParams{})`

I don't see in the todo-list client, any All method or any AllParams struct.
I assume 'Operations' in the line above should be changed to Todos, and 'operations' to 'todos'  to make the todo-list/client work, but where are the 'All' references coming from?


Thanks!

## Environment
swagger version: 2.0
go-swagger version: dev
go version: go1.11.2 darwin/amd64
OS:   MacOS 10.14.2

body:
+1

The example shown in the [docs](https://goswagger.io/generate/client.html) does not work.
I copied the [swagger.yaml](https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/blob/master/examples/todo-list/swagger.yml) and just executed `swagger generate client -f ./swagger.yaml`. But there is no `operations` package generated.
Can you please give an example of how to generate and use the client code?
yes, just send us the PR
Hi there! is it still actual?
Hi! I'd like to work on this issue. Is it still relevant? @casualjim

> Hi! I'd like to work on this issue. Is it still relevant? [@casualjim](https://github.com/casualjim)

Sure. Please go ahead.

issue.title: docs: add quick start and clarify folder structure in client.md
issue.body:
This PR enhances the `docs/generate/client.md` documentation to address confusion reported in issue #2187.

Specifically, it adds:
- A complete Quick Start section with a working `swagger.yaml` example
- A step-by-step explanation of how to initialize a Go module and generate a client
- Clarification on how folder structures change with and without `tags`
- An updated code sample showing how to use the generated client

These improvements aim to help new users understand where folders like `client/operations` come from, and avoid confusion when using tagged operations.

Closes #2187

body:
> Sure. Please go ahead.


PR submitted in #3205 to address this. Let me know if any changes are needed.
